ygData.subject: New paper on evolving more complex behaviours with interactive evolution
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, Pablo Gonz√°lez de Prado Salas and myself are happy to announce a new EvoApps paper titled Interactive Evolution of Complex Behaviours through Skill

Subject: New paper on evolving more complex behaviours with interactive evolution
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=360532607; y=9F5BM1JkOfuuvMhavvMy95Mjdw00RyUFenwNp3nPXrtYonNeTmDMnJs
X-Yahoo-Profile: sebastian.risi
From: Sebastian Risi <sebastian.risi@...>

Hi all,

Pablo Gonz=C3=A1lez de Prado Salas and myself are happy to announc=
e a new
EvoApps paper titled "Interactive Evolution of Complex Behaviours
t=
hrough Skill Encapsulation".

PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uplo=
ads/salas_evoapps17.pdf

This paper tries to address the challenge of using=
 Interactive
Evolutionary Computation (IEC) to create more complex agent
be=
haviours. While IEC has shown promise in a variety of different
domains, ev=
olving more complex or hierarchically composed behaviours
is often difficul=
t. To overcome this challenge, this paper combines
the recently introduced =
ESP (encapsulation, syllabus and pandemonium)
algorithm with IEC to allow u=
sers to break complex challenges into
smaller pieces and preserve, reuse an=
d combine interactively evolved
sub-skills.

We believe the combination of =
ESP principles with IEC provides a new
way in which human insights can be l=
everaged in evolutionary
computation and, as the results in this paper show=
, IEC-ESP is able to
solve some complex control problems that are challengi=
ng for a
traditional fitness-based approach.

A video of the system in acti=
on can be found here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DimS_Cikq6sc

Lookin=
g forward to your thoughts!

Best,
Sebastian

-- 
Dr. Sebastian Risi
Associ=
ate Professor
IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D12
Rued Langgaards Vej 7,=
 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
